subject: Management
title: Tasks Only You Can Do
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Tasks Only You Can Do.

hook.text: A VP spent two hours a day formatting reports. Nobody asked her toâ€”she just always had.

buildup.text: Some tasks require your unique authority, judgment, or relationships. Most tasks don't.

discovery.text: The 'only I can do this' list is almost always shorter than managers think.

twist.text: Hiring decisions, crisis escalations, and strategyâ€”yes. Formatting slidesâ€”never.

climax.text: Write your actual 'only-me' list. You'll be surprised how short it is.

punchline.text: If someone else can do it, someone else should.

quiz.question: What usually happens when managers list tasks only they can do?
options: The list turns out to be surprisingly short
The list covers most of their daily work
They realize they need to hire more staff
